    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Configures the application to behave in the way specified through the arguments. If the guiOption is found, any other argument is skipped and a new instance of MainWindow is displayed. Otherwise, if the outputFileOption is contained in args, the application will wait for a path (any validation check will be performed later, so we accept any kind of string not starting with a "-"). At last, if other arguments are found, having said that none of them is allowed to start with a "-", they're treated as a list of paths from which the application should read. Nevertheless, considering that Epsylon currently support only one input file, only the last typed path is considered.
        Parameters:
        args - The list of arguments passed to the application.

      • parse

        public static Node parse(java.lang.String input)
                  throws ParseException
        Instantiates a new Parser and calls its parse method on a specified input string.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string on which the Parser should work.
        Returns:
        A valid Node, if the parsing is successful.
        Throws:
        ParseException - If the input cannot be parsed.

      • typecheck

        public static Type typecheck(Node tree)
                      throws TypecheckException
        Instantiates a new Typechecker and calls its typecheck method on a specified tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - A tree built by an instance of Parser.
        Returns:
        The resulting Type of the expression, if the typechecking is successful.
        Throws:
        TypecheckException - If the tree contains a typecheck error.

      • evaluate

        public static Value evaluate(Node tree)
                      throws EvaluationException
        Instantiates a new Evaluator and calls its evaluate method on a specified tree. The evaluation can work even though the tree has not been typechecked.
        Parameters:
        tree - A tree built by an instance of Parser.
        Returns:
        The resulting Value of the expression, if the evaluation is successful.
        Throws:
        EvaluationException - If the tree cannot be evaluated.
